text: "As you walk and eat and travel, be where you are. Otherwise you will miss most of your life."
"Dharma is undiscriminated and incommunicable, since name and form are nonproduction, nonstopping, nondefilement, and nonpurification."
"Hard is it to be born as a man, Hard is the life of immortals, Hard is it to hear the Truth Sublime, Hard as well is the Buddha's rise."
"To be a mother is sweet, and a father. It is sweet to live arduously and to master yourself."
"Were there a mountain all made of gold, doubled that would not be enough to satisfy a single man: know this and live accordingly."
"A person of integrity after death reappears in the destination of people of integrity -- Greatness among devas or among human beings."
"What we think, we become."
"I realized that the earth, water, fire, air, space and consciousness elements are void of a self."
"2/2 the fool."
"The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows."
"2/2 your own common sense."
"A virtuous donor offers to one without virtues."
"From the non-beingness of beings should the non-beingness of all dharmas be known."
"Follow the awakened and from among the blind the light of your wisdom will shine out, purely."
"Let the wise guard their thoughts, which are difficult to perceive, extremely subtle, and wander at will."
"A dream is all of this, an echo, a magical creation."
"There is the taking on of a practice that is painful in the present and yields pain in the future."
"Seek refuge with the Three Jewels, fulfill all moral precepts, and do not lower your dignity or neglect any ceremonial observance."
"A wise man, recognizing that the world is but an illusion, does not act as if it is real, so he escapes the suffering."
"Be vigilant; guard your mind against negative thoughts."
"Abstain from buying and selling and unfair ways of weighing and measuring."
"The six internal and external spheres are eye and form, ear and sound, nose and smell, tongue and taste, body and touch and mind and idea."
"When neither a dual dharma nor a non-dual dharma is apprehended, is the way the knowledge of all modes is attained."
"The glorious chariots of kings shatter, the body turns to dust. But the spirit of purity is changeless and so the pure instruct the pure."

"A Bodhisattva, by means of a thought associated with the knowledge of all modes, contemplates form as impermanent, suffering and wishless."
"The fading and cessation, renunciation, relinquishment, release, and letting go of craving is the cessation of self-identification."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the heard, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind I abide."
"When neither a dual or non-dual dharma is apprehended, the knowledge of all modes is attained by way of taking nothing at all as a basis."
"Do not assume form to be the self, or the self as possessing form, or form as in the self, or the self as in form."
"A Bodhisattva does not see any dharma that is being produced without a cause, nor does he review any dharma as permanent or impermanent."
"He who for the sake of happiness hurts others who also want happiness, shall not hereafter find happiness."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the heard, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind I abide."
"Turn away from mischief. Again and again, turn away. Before sorrow befalls you. Set your heart on doing good."
"To cease from evil, to do good, and to purify the mind yourself, this is the teaching of all the Buddha."
"Not seizing does not worry. Not worried is internally extinguished. Birth is destroyed."
"The Bodhisattva contemplates very deep stations from the emptiness of the subject to the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the seen, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind, I abide."
"Be vigilant; guard your mind against negative thoughts."
"Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind."
"The thought does not occur to a monk that 'I am about to attain the cessation of perception and feeling.'"
"Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds and shine!"
"1/2 The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present"
"When I pulled out sorrow's shaft, I showed you the way. It is you who must make the effort. The masters only point the way."
"Develop potential endowed with interest, concentration, effort, and determination."
"A Bodhisattva will pass on from Buddha-field to Buddha-field and honor therein the Buddhas and Lords, planting wholesome roots with them."
"By your own efforts Waken yourself, watch yourself. And live joyfully."
"The holy life plunges into Unbinding, culminates in Unbinding, has Unbinding as its final end."
"Let the wise guard their thoughts, which are difficult to perceive, extremely subtle, and wander at will."
"Those who wish to be born in the Western Paradise of the Buddha have to cultivate threefold goodness."
"Good is it to control the mind Which is hard to check and swift And flits wherever it desires. A subdued mind is conducive to happiness."
"Fresh milk takes time to sour. So a fool's mischief"
"For a while the fool's mischief Tastes sweet, sweet as honey. Bit in the end it turns bitter. And how bitterly he suffers!"
"Who is awake, strong and humble, Who masters hiself and minds the law."
"Be fond of unity and speak words to unite. Give up rough talk, say pleasing words that go straight to the heart of all."
"Do not ask for family or power or wealth, either for yourself or another. Can a wise person wish to rise unjustly?"
"All beings fear before danger, life is dear to all. When a man considers this, he does not kill or cause to kill."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the sensed, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind I abide."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the cognized, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind I abide."
"Like a lovely flower, bright and fragrant, are the fine and truthful words of one who means what they say."
"It is your mind that creates this world."
"Both go into the dark. And in the next world suffer For they offend truth."
"I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done."
"Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others."
"For a while the fool's mischief Tastes sweet, sweet as honey. Bit in the end it turns bitter. And how bitterly he suffers!"
"Satisfied covering the body with robes and feeding the belly with morsels I went with all my belongings wherever I went."
"The absence of thought is without modification or discrimination. It is the true nature of all dharmas -- unthinkable no-thoughthood."
"Remain with the Dharma as an island and the Dharma as your refuge."
"One is not low because of birth nor does birth make one holy. Deeds alone make one low, deeds alone make one holy."
"With gentleness overcome anger. With generosity overcome meanness. With truth overcome deceit."
"1/2 Meditation brings wisdom; lack of mediation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what hold you back, and choose the"
"If he makes himself as good as he tells others to be, then he in truth can teach others. Difficult indeed is self-control."
"Endowed with the noble ones’ control of the mental faculties, I experienced the untouched pleasure of the mental faculties."
"Let a man overcome anger by love."
"The mind released through wisdom here and now; knowing and realizing, one with the destruction of desires is a recluse."
"So a person who's wise, out of regard for his own good, should always show due respect"
"The ignorant man is an ox. He grows in size, not in wisdom."
"Easy to do are things that are bad and harmful to oneself. But exceedingly difficult to do are things that are good and beneficial."
"Death overtakes one who cares only for his flocks and his children. Death fetches them away, as a flood carries off a sleeping village."
"Speak or act with an pure mind And happiness will follow you As your shadow, unshakable."
"Beware of the anger of the mouth. Master your words."
"Develop potential endowed with interest, concentration, effort, and determination."
"In a world that has become blind I go to beat the drum of the Deathless."
"Everything arises and passes away. When you see this, you are above sorrow. This is the shining way."
"Let them show their conviction."
"'I have sons, I have wealth'; So thinks the fool and is troubled. He himself is not his own. How then are sons, how wealth?"
"A Bodhisattva has approached all dharmas as having nonexistence for their own-being and has not appropriated them."
"From the non-beingness of beings should the non-beingness of all dharmas be known."
"Just as the view of individuality includes sixty two false views, so all the perfections are included in this deep perfection of wisdom."
"It is nature's law that rivers wind, trees grow wood, and, given the opportunity, women work iniquity."
"Though one may conquer a thousand times a thousand men in battle, yet he indeed is the noblest victor who conquers himself."
"Better than a thousand hollow verses Is one verse that brings peace."
"The emptiness concentration contemplates all dharmas as empty of own-marks ... emptiness as a door to deliverance."
"All dharmas are isolated in their essence, empty of their essence and thus exist through the mark of emptiness, the mark of isolated-ness."
"Awake. Be the witness of your thoughts."
"Non-production is not one or two, not many or single."
"A Bodhisattva, mounted on the great vehicle, sees that 'bodhi-being' is a mere conventional expression since no being can be apprehended."
"If a man going down into a river, swollen and swiftly flowing, is carried away by the current - how can he help others across?"
"To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life; foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent."
"Most have not obtained the divine eye and cannot perceive what is at a distance. Yet, Buddhas can give you a glimpse of the Buddha fields."

"When visiting a teacher ask: 'what is skillful? What, having been done by me, will lead to my long-term welfare and happiness?'"
"The tongue, like a sharp knife, kills without drawing blood."
"To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance."
"A Bodhisattva does not abandon ascetic practices, this is the patient acquiescence in the deep dharmas in which meditation discloses."
"Learn this from the waters: in mountain clefts and chasms, loud gush the streamlets, but great rivers flow silently."
"The emptiness concentration contemplates all dharmas as empty of own-marks ... emptiness as a door to deliverance."
"As you walk and eat and travel, be where you are. Otherwise you will miss most of your life."
"Should a man commit evil, Let him not do it again and again, Nor turn his heart to delight therein; Painful is the heaping-up of evil."
"You can surely not assume that the real essence of form has actually been apprehended."
"Following the seven lights of awakening and rejoicing greatly in freedom, the wise become a light -- pure, shining and free!"
"Desire never crosses the path Of virtuous and wakeful men."
"There is only non-voidness, the single state dependent on perception of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception."
"2/2 bliss supreme."
"The mind is everything; what you think you become."
"Most have not obtained the divine eye and cannot perceive what is at a distance. Yet, Buddhas can give you a glimpse of the Buddha fields."
"Do not look for bad company Or live with men who do not care. Find friends who love the truth. Drink deeply. Live in serenity and joy."
"There are Bodhisattvas who, having stood in the six perfections, illuminate beings with the Buddhadharma."
"The Bodhisattva nowhere apprehends a dharma which could affect him, or whereby or wherein he could be affected."
"Better than a thousand hollow words Is one word that brings peace."
"Of your words and your thoughts. Delight in meditation And in solitude."

"Follow the shinning ones, the wise, the awakened, the loving. Follow them as the moon follows the path of the stars."

"All the Buddhas owe their enlightenment to this very perfection of wisdom, whether they live in the past, future, or present."
"Everything arises and passes away. When you see this, you are above sorrow. This is the shining way."
"The foolish common people have settled down in ignorance and craving. They have constructed dharmas out of their ignorance and craving."

"Better than a thousand hollow verses Is one verse that brings peace."
"The glorious chariots of kings shatter, the body turns to dust. But the spirit of purity is changeless and so the pure instruct the pure."
"Ye must leave righteous ways behind, not to speak of unrighteous ways."
"Know desires, their arising, their  cessation. Release the mind from sensual desires, from desires ‘to be’ and from ignorant desires."
"You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection."

"The wind cannot overturn a mountain. Temptation cannot touch the man"
"There is the taking on of a practice that is painful in the present but yields pleasure in the future."
"Easy to do are things that are bad and harmful to oneself. But exceedingly difficult to do are things that are good and beneficial."
"Nothing real is meant by the word Bodhisattva. Unproduced is enlightenment and unproduced is a being. There is no trace of them anywhere."
"This is the great vehicle of a Bodhisattva that, in all their modes, he develops the dharmas which are the 37 wings to enlightenment."
"To share happiness. And to have done something good Before leaving this life is sweet"

"There are three kinds of omniscience: The knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of the paths, and all-knowledge."

"Do not what is evil. Do what is good. Keep your mind pure. This is the teaching."
"To see the Western Paradise, meditate in the western direction, and prepare your thoughts for a meditation on the setting sun."
"Happiness or sorrow - Whatever befalls you, Walk on Untouched, unattached."
"The one who knows has declared this world and the other world, what could be attained by death and what could not be attained by death."
"The religious life does not depend on dogma. Whether the world is eternal or not, whether the world is finite or not, there exists sorrow."
"There is only non-voidness, the single state dependent on the presence of perception of the base consisting of nothingness."
"When neither a dual dharma nor a non-dual dharma is apprehended, is the way the knowledge of all modes is attained."
"Make haste in doing good, And check your mind from evil. Whoso is slow in making merit-His mind delights in evil."
"The monk becomes learned that anything is not suitable to settle in."
"Seeing it an error to fall for the heard, not settling, unbound, released, unyoked and with an unrestricted mind I abide."
"A wise man, recognizing that the world is but an illusion, does not act as if it is real, so he escapes the suffering."
"The fool is his own enemy. The mischief is his undoing."
"Develop mindfulness of body. Pursue it, give it transport, give it a grounding. Steady it, consolidate it, set about it properly."
"Emptiness does not do anything whatever to anything, nor does it not do anything."

"Suffering because life cannot satisfy selfish desire is like suffering because a banana tree will not bear mangoes."

"For the sake others the Bodhisattva sacrifices himself. In this way he works the weal of beings by whatever method possible."
"A wise man, recognizing that the world is but an illusion, does not act as if it is real, so he escapes the suffering."

"To understand everything is to forgive everything."
"Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others."
"Know well what leads you forward and what hold you back, and choose the path that leads to wisdom."
"There is no fire like passion No crime like hatred,No sorrow like separation, No sickness like hunger, And no joy like the joy of freedom."
"The Bodhisattva enters the samadhis, the unlimited, the formless attainments, but does not take hold of their karmic result."
"2/2 And pass beyond the sight of the King of Death."
"Ultimate reality means Nirvana and Nirvana is empty of Nirvana on account of its being neither unmoved nor destroyed."
"Since all dharmas are empty, well informed people do not settle down in them."
"The world always finds a way to praise and a way to blame. It always has and it always will."
"He who for the sake of happiness hurts others who also want happiness, shall not hereafter find happiness."

"1/2 From meditation springs wisdom. From lack of meditation, loss of wisdom. Recognizing these alternative roads of progress and decline,"
"Go beyond likes and dislikes, passion and desire, sensuousness and lust, grief and fear, free yourself from attachment."
"Overcome the angry by non-anger; overcome the wicked by goodness; overcome the miser by generosity; overcome the liar by truth."
"Speak or act with an impure mind And trouble will follow you."
